sub_title: Project Management Office Lead   at Shell
summary:
After an extensive career within two international companies I accepted a role as PMO Lead supporting multiple complicated programs which put me in the position to to make use of my global skills and experiences in business support and organisational improvement and development.

I have a very strong focus on Customer relation with the ability and skills to simplify complexity and to work across borders.  Enjoys the diversity when working in global teams, Supporting Customers and/or collaborating with business stakeholders in other parts of the world.

In addition to that I am a committed leader with a strong drive to motivate people/teams to collaborate in an effective corporative and efficient way in order to deliver excellent services with added business value as an outcome.

Competencies and Skils:
•	40 years of experience in various IT Infrastructure supporting roles including Global Management on Director level within the AT&T Managed Shell account.
•	An all-round professional working in complex and international environments. 
•	Extensive experience in management of international and cross-functional teams.
•	Practical attitude and strong focus on high quality. 
•	Good communicator on all levels, from executive management to technical professionals.
•	Excellent networking skills.
•	Strong customer focus

•	AT&T Certified Scrum Master
•	ITIL Service Manager (Service Support)
•	Project Management (Boertien en Partners)
•	Aspect ACD Management

Languages:
•	Dutch   (Native) 
•	English (Fluent)

profile_positions.description:
SEP Project Management Office (PMO) provides back office support at both programmatic and project level. Their key activities include financial tracking, RAID analysis, governance support, and reporting.
The Services and Enhancements Programme (SEP) supports a wide variety of projects that run efficiently under multiple workstreams
profile_positions.title: Project Management Office Lead

profile_positions.description: A short assignment (4 months) to support the PMO team within the IPPD PSO (Project Services Operations) organisation.
profile_positions.title: Project Request Consultant (PRC)

profile_positions.description:
AT&T Project Management Office is the first point of contact when interfacing with one of AT&T's International Customers (Shell) and other involved supplier PMO’s for all project related activities.

In this role I lead and coach a Global Project Management Office with up to 30+ global staff based in:   
•	EMEA - Netherlands, United Kingdom, Germany.
•	AM - US, Canada.
•	AP  - Malaysia, Singapore, India 
   
Tasks and responsibilities:
•	Overall responsibility for Project intake and first high level evaluation.
•	Initiated, monitored and quality assured up to 800 active global projects on a yearly bases.
•	Ensure contractual agreement on required services, timeline and budget.
•	Quality Assurance active projects against current AT&T standards and the Customer agreed Critical Service Levels.   
•	Overall responsibility for project time writing and financial/billing support.
•	Ensure close alignment with involved IT service delivery partners. 
•	Reporting - Scheduled and ad-hock requirements.
profile_positions.title: Director  Global Project Office (Shell account)

profile_positions.description:
Tasks and responsibilities:
•	To co-ordinate and prioritize on a global basis the flow, execution and fulfilment of all categories of telecom project requests coming in from Shell business units.
•	Responsible for global staff assignments within the Design Office team for Telecom Projects. 
•	The Shell Design Office team is made up of approximately 40+ staff spread across 3 primary regional units in the Netherlands, US and Malaysia. 
•	Oversee the request processes which involve telecoms changes and to track and report on the various requests and projects involving telecoms.
•	To provide STO Management with detailed information on project statuses and results required to make informed decision and to build appropriate strategies for effectively handling of Telecom Projects.

•	Act as deputy for the STO Design Office Manager for the daily course of business. 
•	Define global Architecture and Design work processes and ensure consistency in the execution of these processes.
profile_positions.title: Global Resource Manager Architecture & Design
